home.title: Free Sorting Task
home.description: «FST-LAB» is a tool dedicated to the implementation of a free sorting task (or Free Categorisation Task) with auditory and/or visual stimuli.
home.description2: Easily configure tasks, take participants inside the lab or remotely, download your results, and only if you want, share your configurations and data with other users.

objectives.title: How to use the platform (freely)
objectives.description1: Use the 'Register' button at the top right of this screen to register with the platform.
objectives.description2: After accepting your registration, you will be able to configure your next experiment!

features.title: What you can do with FST-LAB

creation.title: During the creation of the experiment (as experimenters):
creation.item1: you can choose sounds, pictures or both in the same experiment
creation.item2: you can choose a random order of stimuli (or not)
creation.item3: you can choose the size and color of the buttons on the screen
creation.item4: you can upload sounds or pictures up to 20 MB by file
creation.item5: you can set the instructions for the participant
creation.item6: you can insert in your experience all the files connected to your work (articles, agreements, etc.)
creation.item7: you can manage session of experiment with different modes (start, pause, stop, test)
creation.item8: you can generate and send a link to run experiment (only), where you want

during.title: During the experiment by itself (as participants):
during.item2: you can move stimuli on the fullscreen view

end.title: At the end of the experiment (as experimenters):
end.item1: groups of stimuli are made automatically (if the icons are close enough to each other) and can be modified if necessary
end.item2: you can add a comment on each group using keyboard or voice dictation
end.item3: you can comment on all the experiments

run.title: At the end of each run (as experimenters):
run.item2: you can see basic statistics on the running, including time and a number of groups
run.item3: you can download results in various formats with a little R script to easily visualize data

global.title: Globally (as experimenters):
global.item1: you can make your experiment public so that it can be seen by all users of FST-LAB
global.item2: you can share your experiment with another user for limited collaboration (read and download results)
global.item3: you can share your experiment with another user for full collaboration (read, download results and edit experiment)
global.item4: you can download all your experiment files (JSON or XML)

privacy.gdpr: Please respect the European regulations regarding data, i.e. the GDPR (General Data Protection Regulation)

changelog.title: Changelog
changelog.subtitle: Follow the evolution of our experimentation platform

version_one.description: First stable version of the experimentation platform

auth_users.title: Authentication System and User Management
features: Registration with ORCID verification and university affiliation
Approval system for new accounts by the supervisor
Email notifications for registration and approval steps
Role management: Supervisor, Main Experimenter, Secondary Experimenter
Ban system with justification and notifications
Administrator contact page for special requests

experiments.title: Experiment Management
features: Creation of experiments with multimedia support (images and sounds)
Unique DOI system for each experiment
Test mode with visualization in How It Works

ui.title: User Interface
features: Integration of Terms of Service during registration

fixes.title: Fixes
features: Fixed display bugs for secondary experimenters

upcoming_version.title: Upcoming Features
features: When exporting results as ZIP, option to choose export format with or without participants
When exporting results, an R file is added to the ZIP archive
Added confetti when participant completes the experiment
In experiment creation, it is now mandatory to provide the institution responsible for the experiment
In experiment creation, you can provide regulatory documents (CER and other official documents)
Advanced statistics on the experiment as a whole
fixes: Fixed a display bug on the results page
When the user completes the experiment, the clustering algorithm to determine group membership has been improved

article1.title: 1. Website Presentation
article1.para1: Pursuant to Article 6 of Law No. 2004-575 of June 21, 2004 on confidence in the digital economy, users of the FST-LAB website are informed of the identity of the various parties involved in its creation and monitoring:
article1.owner: CNRS USR 3414 MSHS-T - SIRET 18008901300676 – 16 av. Edouard Belin 31 400 Toulouse
article1.creator: House of Human and Social Sciences
article1.publisher: The publication manager is either a natural person or a legal entity.
article1.host: Toulouse - Jean Jaurès University – 5 allées Antion Machado - 31058 TOULOUSE - CEDEX 1
article1.credits_html: Pascal Gaillard - pascal.gaillard@univ-tlse2.fr and Kévin Dupas - dupas.dev@gmail.com
article1.notice_html: The legal notice template is provided by Subdelirium.com Legal Notice Generator

article2.title: 2. General Terms of Use for the Website and Services
article2.para1: Using the FST-LAB website implies full acceptance of the general terms of use described below. These terms of use may be modified or supplemented at any time, so users of the FST-LAB website are invited to consult them regularly.
article2.para2: This site is normally accessible to users at all times. However, MSHS-T may decide to interrupt access for technical maintenance and will endeavor to communicate the dates and times of such interventions to users in advance.

article3.title: 3. Description of Services Provided
article3.para1: The FST-LAB website aims to provide an application for creating, conducting, and sharing experiments using the "free categorization" protocol.
article3.para2: MSHS-T strives to provide information on the FST-LAB website that is as accurate as possible. However, it cannot be held responsible for omissions, inaccuracies, or deficiencies in updates, whether caused by itself or by third-party partners who provide this information.
article3.para3: All information indicated on the FST-LAB website is provided for informational purposes only and is subject to change.

article4.title: 4. Contractual Limitations on Technical Data
article4.para1: The website uses JavaScript technology. The website cannot be held responsible for material damage related to the use of the site. Additionally, the user agrees to access the site using recent equipment, free of viruses, and with an up-to-date browser.
article4.item1: The FST-LAB website is optimized for modern browsers and may not function properly on outdated browsers.
article4.item2: For an optimal experience, we recommend using the latest versions of Chrome, Firefox, Safari, or Edge.
article4.item3: JavaScript must be enabled in your browser to enjoy all the features of the site.

article5.title: 5. Intellectual Property and Infringement
article5.para1: MSHS-T owns the intellectual property rights or holds usage rights for all elements accessible on the site, including texts, images, graphics, logos, icons, sounds, and software.
article5.para2: Any reproduction, representation, modification, publication, or adaptation of all or part of the elements of the site, regardless of the means or process used, is prohibited without prior written authorization from MSHS-T. Any unauthorized use of the site or any of its elements will be considered as constituting an infringement and prosecuted in accordance with the provisions of Articles L.335-2 et seq. of the Intellectual Property Code.

article6.title: 6. Limitations of Liability
article6.para1: MSHS-T cannot be held responsible for direct or indirect damage caused to the user's equipment when accessing the FST-LAB website, resulting either from the use of equipment that does not meet the specifications indicated in point 4, or from the occurrence of a bug or incompatibility.
article6.para2: MSHS-T cannot also be held responsible for indirect damages (such as loss of market or loss of opportunity) resulting from the use of the FST-LAB website.
article6.para3: Interactive spaces (ability to ask questions in the contact area) are available to users. MSHS-T reserves the right to remove, without prior notice, any content posted in this space that would violate applicable law in France, particularly provisions relating to data protection. If necessary, MSHS-T also reserves the right to question the civil and/or criminal liability of the user, especially in the case of messages of a racist, offensive, defamatory, or pornographic nature, regardless of the medium used (text, photograph, etc.).

article7.title: 7. Personal Data Management
article7.para1_html: The information collected about you will be processed by the director of MSHS-T and the Data Protection Officer – dpd.demandes@cnrs.fr. Personal data is collected and processed for the following purpose: managing user profiles on the platform.
article7.para2: In accordance with Article 6 of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of April 27, 2016, this processing is based on the legitimate interest pursued by the data controller. The data collected about you includes your first and last name, your status, and your affiliated laboratory. No data is transferred outside the European Union.
article7.para3: Data is retained for 24 months. Beyond this period, all personal data concerning you will be removed from the site. Any person concerned by this personal data processing can access and obtain a copy of their data, object to the processing of this data, have it rectified, or have it erased. You also have the right to limit the processing of your data.
article7.para4_html: You can exercise these rights by contacting Pascal Gaillard - pascal.gaillard@univ-tlse2.fr. If you believe, after contacting us, that your Information Technology and Freedom rights have not been respected, you can submit a complaint to the CNIL: https://www.cnil.fr/fr/webform/adresser-une-plainte. Databases are protected by the provisions of the law of July 1, 1998, transposing Directive 96/9 of March 11, 1996 on the legal protection of databases.

article8.title: 8. Hyperlinks and Cookies
article8.para1: The FST-LAB website contains a number of hyperlinks to other sites, set up with the authorization of MSHS-T. However, MSHS-T does not have the ability to verify the content of the sites visited, and therefore assumes no responsibility for this fact.
article8.para2: Browsing the FST-LAB website may cause cookies to be installed on the user's computer. A cookie is a small file that does not allow identification of the user but records information related to the navigation of a computer on a site. The data obtained in this way aims to facilitate subsequent navigation on the site and is also intended to allow various measures of site traffic.
article8.para3: Refusing to install a cookie may make it impossible to access certain services. The user can, however, configure their computer as follows to refuse the installation of cookies:
article8.ie: In Internet Explorer: tool tab (gear icon in the top right) / internet options. Click on Privacy and choose Block all cookies. Confirm with Ok.
article8.firefox: In Firefox: at the top of the browser window, click on the Firefox button, then go to the Options tab. Click on the Privacy tab. Set the Rules for history to: use custom settings for history. Finally, uncheck the box to disable cookies.
article8.safari: In Safari: Click at the top right of the browser on the menu icon (symbolized by a gear). Select Settings. Click on Show advanced settings. In the "Privacy" section, click on Content settings. In the "Cookies" section, you can block cookies.
article8.chrome: In Chrome: Click at the top right of the browser on the menu icon (symbolized by three horizontal lines). Select Settings. Click on Show advanced settings. In the "Privacy" section, click on preferences. In the "Privacy" tab, you can block cookies.

article9.title: 9. Applicable Law and Jurisdiction
article9.content: Any dispute relating to the use of the FST-LAB website is subject to French law. Exclusive jurisdiction is given to the competent courts of Paris.

article10.title: 10. Main Laws Concerned
article10.law1: Law No. 78-17 of January 6, 1978, as amended by Law No. 2004-801 of August 6, 2004 relating to information technology, files, and freedoms.
article10.law2: Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of April 27, 2016.
article10.law3: Law No. 2004-575 of June 21, 2004 for confidence in the digital economy.

article11.title: 11. Glossary
article11.user: Internet user connecting to and using the aforementioned site.
article11.personal_info: "Information that allows, in any form whatsoever, directly or indirectly, the identification of the natural persons to whom it applies" (Article 4 of Law No. 78-17 of January 6, 1978).

privacy.title: Personal Data Protection
privacy.intro: The information collected about you is processed by MSHS-T, located at 5 allée Antonio Machado, F-31 058 Toulouse cedex 9, +33 (0)5 61 50 35 28. Information can be requested from the CNRS Data Protection Officer – dpd.demandes@cnrs.fr.
privacy.dataCollected: Personal data such as last name, first name, email address, affiliation structure, or function will be collected.

context.title: In the context of:
context.directory: managing a directory of UAR personnel and associated laboratories (last name, first name, telephone, email address, laboratory, status, function, mission);
context.newsletter: newsletter subscription (last name, first name, email address);
context.events: participation in a scientific event, conference, or training session (last name, first name, email address, institution/laboratory/company, function).

recipients.title: Data Recipients
recipients.organizers: the organizers of each scientific event, conference, or training session.

legalBasis.title: Legal Basis
legalBasis.content: The processing is necessary for the purposes of the legitimate interests pursued by the data controller

retention.title: Data Retention
retention.newsletter: Newsletter subscription: until the data subject requests to unsubscribe
retention.content: Content: for directories, at maximum until the person's departure; for other news items, for the duration of the website's operation

transfer.title: Data Transfer Outside the EU
transfer.content: Information published on the website may be read outside the European Union due to its presence on the Internet.

rights.title: Individual Rights
rights.description: Any person concerned by this personal data processing can access and obtain a copy of their data, object to the processing of this data, have it rectified, or have it erased. You also have the right to limit the processing of your data.

contact.mshs: You can exercise these rights by contacting the MSHS-T communication service:
contact.dpd: You can also contact the CNRS DPO at the following address: DPD –2 rue Jean Zay–54519 –Vandoeuvre lès Nancy Cedex –

rights.cnil: If you believe, after contacting us, that your Information Technology and Freedom rights are not being respected, you have the possibility to file a complaint with the CNIL:
